action.action-desc: Mr. Rodney Davis of Illinois (for himself, Mr. Baird, Mr. Balderson, Mr. Valadao, Mr. LaTurner, Mr. Mann, Mr. Feenstra, Mr. Allen, Mr. Austin Scott of Georgia, Mrs. Miller-Meeks, and Mr. Newhouse) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Agriculture

form.official-title: To amend the Federal Insecticide, Fungicide, and Rodenticide Act to prohibit the local regulation of pesticide use, and for other purposes.

section.header: Prohibiting local regulation of pesticide use
section.text: Section 24 of the Federal Insecticide, Fungicide, and Rodenticide Act (7 U.S.C. 136v) is amendedâ€”

paragraph.text: in the section heading by inserting and localities after States; and
by adding at the end the following:

subsection.text: A political subdivision of a State shall not impose, or continue in effect, any requirement relating to the sale, distribution, labeling, application, or use of any pesticide or device subject to regulation by a State pursuant to this section or by the Administrator under this Act.
